item.title: @MattNeuro The big downside of cylinders is that there's always one person who leaves the valve open, and then the cylinder is empty and needs to be replaced - this does not happen with concentrators. A downside of concentrators is the noise.
item.description: @MattNeuro The big downside of cylinders is that there's always one person who leaves the valve open, and then the cylinder is empty and needs to be replaced - this does not happen with concentrators. A downside of concentrators is the noise.
item.content:encoded: @MattNeuro The big downside of cylinders is that there's always one person who leaves the valve open, and then the cylinder is empty and needs to be replaced - this does not happen with concentrators. A downside of concentrators is the noise.

item.title:
@ptrrupprecht Thank you! I was wondering if noise would be an issue - quite a few ads emphasize "low noise", sounds like this is a common downside.
We currently use quite small cylinders, so have to replace them about every other day even without spillage. It is quite the hassle.

item.title:
In 1936, Alonzo Church and Alan Turing independently solved David Hilbert's Entscheidungsproblem (German for "Decision Problem"), and in doing so, laid the foundations of computer science.
Church would later become Turing's PhD advisor
📝:https://t.co/A0WoHid8sm https://t.co/hxXmGEctau

item.title: Freeman Hrabowski Scholars will be appointed to a five-year term, renewable for a second five-year term after a successful progress evaluation. Each Scholar will receive up to $8.6 million over 10 years. 2/3

item.title: Over the next 20 years, HHMI expects to hire and support up to 150 Freeman Hrabowski Scholars – appointing roughly 30 Scholars every other year for the next 10 years. 3/3
